topic.title: HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Installation Guide

titlealts.searchtitle: HPE Helion Openstack Carrier Grade 1.1: Installation Overivew

body.p: This document describes the process for installing HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in a baremetal environment.

section.title: About the installation
section.p: The HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation installs HPE Helion Lifecycle Management VM, creates a base HPE Helion OpenStack cloud, configures network virtualization through HP Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN), and deploys a carrier grade cloud.
After installation, you can interact with the HPE Helion OpenStack cloud using the Horizon graphical interface or using the CLIs of the respective services.

section.title: Installation options
section.p: HPE Helion OpenStack Carreir Grade has two baremetal installation options depending on your system configuration. It allows you to manage the KVM and VMware ESX hypervisors and provision virtual machines.
You can find more information on the hypervisor options in the Technical Overview.

section.title: KVM Topology
section.p: If you install the KVM deployment, you can integrate either HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HP StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

You must install 3PAR or VSA before starting the HPE Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.

section.title: KVM + ESX Topology
section.p: If installing the KVM + ESX deployment, you will need to perform tasks to integrate ESX and DCN with HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade.
You can also integrate HPE Storevirtual (VSA) or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage in the KVM region.

You must install ESX, 3PAR or VSA before starting the HPE Helion OpenStack installation and are independent of HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. During the installation, you will integrate the storage into HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade. See the installation instructions for the ESX, 3PAR and/or VSA parameters you will need.

section.title: Unbonded or Bonded NIC configuration
section.p: During the installation, specific steps might be different, based on whether you are installing into a single NIC or bonded NIC environment.

section.title: Installation process
section.p: Use the following process to install HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in a baremetal environment.

ol.li:
Review the Technical Overview for information on the HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade environment.
Review the Cloud Topologies to decide appropriate topology for your use case.
Review the deployment architecture for different hypervisors
Review the network architecture for networking needs
Review the Support Matrix to make sure your environment meets the minimum requirements.
Perform any required or optional installation prerequisites.

Install the cloud topologies:
KVM Cloud
In this cloud topology, the standard OpenStack services like Keystone, Glance, Cinder, Swift are installed in the non-KVM region first. Then the KVM region is installed.
Install Helion Lifecycle Management and Installation Services.
Install the HPE Helion OpenStack cloud. These components will be installed into what is called the Non-KVM region.
Launch the Helion user interface.
Install the carrier grade cloud. The carrier grade cloud is deployed into what is called the KVM region.
KVM + ESX Cloud
In this cloud topology, the components required to support ESX hypervisor are installed along with standard services in the non-KVM region first. Then the KVM region is installed.
Install Helion Lifecycle Management and Installation Services.
Install the HP Helion OpenStack cloud and install the HPE Distributed Cloud Networking (DCN) components. You will also install the VMware ESX compute proxy. These components will be installed into what is called the Non-KVM region and connect to the ESX cluster with DCN networking.
Launch the Helion user interface.
Configure required DCN components.
Install the carrier grade cloud. The carrier grade cloud is deployed into what is called the KVM region

section.title: First Step
section.p: Perform the prerequisite steps and one time setup on your lifecycle manager host required to install HPE Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade in a baremetal environment.
